detaileddescription.para: Sets the path to the view files and gets the initial output buffering level
This method is called once in CI_Controller.
A utility function to test if a class is in the self::$_ci_classes array. This function returns the object name if the class tested for is loaded, and returns FALSE if it isn't.
It is mainly used in the form_helper -> _get_validation_object()

simplesect.para: mixed class object name on the CI SuperObject or FALSE

detaileddescription.para: This function lets users load and instantiate classes. It is designed to be called from a user's app controllers.
This function lets users load and instantiate models.

parameterdescription.para: whether to return the DB object
whether to enable active record (this allows us to override the config setting)

detaileddescription.para: This function is used to load a "view" file. It has three parameters:

listitem.para: The name of the "view" file to be included.
An associative array of data to be extracted for use in the view.
TRUE/FALSE - whether to return the data or load it. In some cases it's advantageous to be able to return data so that a developer can process it in some way.

detaileddescription.para: This is a generic file loader
Once variables are set they become available within the controller class and its "view" files.
Check if a variable is set and retrieve it.
This function loads the specified helper file.
This is simply an alias to the above function in case the user has written the plural form of this function.
Prepends a parent path to the library, model, helper, and config path arrays
Return a list of all package paths, by default it will ignore BASEPATH.
Remove a path from the library, model, and helper path arrays if it exists If no path is provided, the most recently added path is removed.
This function is used to load views and files. Variables are prefixed with ci to avoid symbol collision with variables made available to view files
This function loads the requested class.

parameterdescription.para: the item that is being loaded

detaileddescription.para: Takes an object as input and converts the class variables to array key/vals
Get a reference to a specific library or model
This function preps the name of various items to make loading them more reliable.
The config/autoload.php file contains an array that permits sub-systems, libraries, and helpers to be loaded automatically.
